metadata.title: CVE-2018-5710 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-5710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.18.3-6
krb5-gss-samples - 1.18.3-6
krb5-k5tls - 1.18.3-6
krb5-kdc - 1.18.3-6
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.18.3-6
krb5-kpropd - 1.18.3-6
krb5-locales - 1.18.3-6
krb5-multidev - 1.18.3-6
krb5-otp - 1.18.3-6
krb5-pkinit - 1.18.3-6
krb5-user - 1.18.3-6
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.18.3-6
libgssrpc4 - 1.18.3-6
libk5crypto3 - 1.18.3-6
libkadm5clnt-mit12 - 1.18.3-6
libkadm5srv-mit12 - 1.18.3-6
libkdb5-10 - 1.18.3-6
libkrad0 - 1.18.3-6
libkrb5-3 - 1.18.3-6
libkrb5support0 - 1.18.3-6
No subscription required

notes.note: ccdm94> this CVE was patched as CVE-2018-5729.

criterions.comment: krb5 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.18.3-6').
